entry.title: The Obsessive Pleasures of Mechanical-Keyboard Tinkerers
entry.quote: On the right machine, typing can be like playing a Steinway grand. Is tactile perfection possible?

entry.title: Here Is the Manual for the Mass Surveillance Tool Cops Use to Track Phones
entry.quote: Police departments across the U.S. have been using Fog Reveal for ‘mass surveillance on a budget,’ investigations by the EFF and Associated Press revealed. Now, we're publishing the manual.

entry.title: Apple Maps Turns 10 — And It’s Finally Worth Using
entry.quote: Even though it still has room to grow, nearly 10 years after the release of Maps, the company has turned it from a complete joke into pretty usable for many people. If you had told me that would be the case the day Maps launched, I’m not sure I would have believed you.

entry.title: Folk Interfaces
entry.quote: People reappropriating existing software to solve their own unique problems

entry.title: An AI-Generated Artwork Won First Place at a State Fair Fine Arts Competition
entry.quote: But Allen did not paint “Théâtre D'opéra Spatial,” AI software called Midjourney did. It used his prompts, but Allen did not wield a digital brush. This distinction has caused controversy on Twitter where working artists and enthusiasts accused Allen of hastening the death of creative jobs.
